data.title: Crescent City Around the Neighborhoods for December 14, 2016
data.meta_description: FEDERAL EMPLOYEES: Chapter 1398 of the National Association of Active and Retired Federal Employees will install officers during its Christmas party beginning at 11 a.m. Wednesday, Dec. 14, in the
data.text:
FEDERAL EMPLOYEES: Chapter 1398 of the National Association of Active and Retired Federal Employees will install officers during its Christmas party beginning at 11 a.m. Wednesday, Dec. 14, in the Sicilian Room of Rocky & Carlo's Restaurant, 613 W. St. Bernard Highway, Chalmette. All active and retired federal employees are invited, along with a guest or two.

NEIGHBORHOOD EMPOWERMENT NETWORK: The Lower 9th Ward Neighborhood Empowerment Network Association will hold a holiday reception from 4 p.m. to 7 p.m. Thursday, Dec. 15, at 1123 Lamanche St., New Orleans. To let them know you're coming, call (504) 373-6483.

ERACE: Erace discussions of racism and other forms of oppression are held Saturdays from 10 a.m. to 11:30 a.m. in the Westfeldt Room at Christ Church Cathedral, 2919 St. Charles Ave., New Orleans.

CHILDREN'S HOSPITAL: St. Charles Parish officials are collecting toys for patients at Children’s Hospital in New Orleans through Friday, Dec. 16. Donations for patients from birth to age 21 may be dropped off at the Planning and Zoning Office, 14996 River Road, Hahnville. Parish employees will deliver the toys to Children’s Hospital the week of the Christmas. Gifts should be unwrapped and in their original packaging. Handmade items cannot be accepted. For more information, call Rechelle Fonseca or Anedra Coleman at (985) 783-5000 or email acoleman@stcharlesgov.net.

"PRESERVING SECOND-LINE CULTURE": A group photography exhibition showcasing modern second-line culture is on display through Friday, Dec. 16, at the Jazz & Heritage Gallery, 1205 N. Rampart St., New Orleans. Seven contemporary New Orleans photographers are represented in "Preserving New Orleans' Second-Line Culture": Judy Cooper, Brad Edelman, L.J. Goldstein, Charles M. Lovell, M.J. Mastrogiovanni, Jerry Moran and Leslie Parr. Admission is free; hours are from 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Monday through Friday.

LAKEVIEW SHEPHERD CENTER: The Lakeview Shepherd Center will hold its monthly Golden Luncheon at 11 a.m. Friday, Dec. 16, at the Community Church Unitarian Universalist, 6690 Fleur de Lis Dr., New Orleans. Tickets are $5 at the door. St. Paul's Church was host of the October luncheon, which featured entertainment by Formosa Grace and the Silver Line Dancers and a craft raffle, along with ample servings of homemade jambalaya.

KIDS CELEBRATION: Crafts and cookie decorating, pictures with Santa and a visit from the Sugar Plum Fairy will be part of the parish kids celebration from 2 p.m. to 4 p.m. Sunday, Dec. 18, in the community room at St. Rita School, 194 Ravan Ave., Harahan. The event is being organized by the St. Rita Home and School Association and the Women’s Auxiliary. Tickets are $15 for children and $10 for adults and must be purchased in advance. The phone number for the school is (504) 737-0744.

NEW ORLEANS JAZZ CLUB: The New Orleans Jazz Club will hold a jam session from 2 p.m. to 6 p.m. Sunday, Dec. 18, at Mo's Chalet, 3201 Houma Blvd., Metairie. There is no cover charge. The phone number for the nightclub is (504) 780-2961.

PEOPLE PROGRAM: Registration for People Program spring classes for retirees 50 and older is open at both locations: 2240 Lakeshore Drive, New Orleans, (504) 284-7678; and Holy Spirit Catholic Church, 6201 Stratford Place, Algiers, (504) 394-5433. Registration will be open from 9 a.m. to noon and from 1 p.m. to 2 p.m. More than 120 classes are offered over a 15-week period. For a $150 fee, participants can take as many classes as they like, choosing from among topics such as language, computer, genealogy, art, dance and history. For information, visit www.peopleprogram.org.

DANCE CLASSES: USA Dance Chapter 5031 holds dance classes for all ages from 7 p.m. to 8 p.m. Wednesdays in the fellowship hall of Lakeview Presbyterian Church, 5914 Canal Blvd., New Orleans. No partner is needed. For information or to register, call Mary Tusa at (504) 837-5377.

TOM BENSON BIOGRAPHER: Kathy Finn, author of "Tom Benson, A Billionaire's Journey," will discuss the book and sign copies at 7 p.m. Dec. 21 at the East Bank Regional Library, 4747 W. Napoleon Ave., Metairie. This event is free.

DWI ENFORCEMENT GRANT: The Plaquemines Parish Sheriff's Office recently received a $24,000 grant from the Louisiana Highway Safety Commission to pay deputies overtime for enforcement of laws prohibiting impaired driving and requiring occupant protection with seat belts and child safety seats. In 2015, 60 percent of all people killed in Louisiana crashes were not wearing seat belts or properly restrained in a child passenger safety seat.

PLAQUEMINES PARISH SHERIFF'S OFFICE: The deputies of the quarter for the Plaquemines Parish Sheriff's Office are Lt. David Klegin Sr. and human resources manager Valerie Ingraham. Sheriff Gerald A. Turlich Jr. cited Klegin's work in the apprehension of a Nairn shooting suspect in July, and Ingraham's work facilitating the transition when Turlich took office in July.

AUTUMN AUCTION: The St. Charles Women's Club raised $6,410 for community projects during its recent Autumn Auction at the Professional Learning Center in Luling. More than 100 club members donated items that were auctioned off by Anthony Lucia of Roussell's Antiques. Pam Shepard and Sally Shexnayder are chairwomen of the club's Ways and Means Committee.

CIVIL AIR PATROL: The 75th anniversary of the founding of the Civil Air Patrol was marked with a ceremony Dec. 3 at the National WWII Museum in New Orleans. Louisiana Wing Commander Col. Thomas “Doc” Barnard spoke about Civil Air Patrol’s work during World War II and its present day mission. Today, it is both a federally chartered benevolent corporation and the volunteer auxiliary of the U. S. Air Force. Its members additionally play a leading role in aerospace education and serve as mentors to more than 24,000 young people participating in the CAP cadet program.

"UN DROLE DE PAROISSIEN": Alliance Française de La Nouvelle-Orléans is presenting screenings of "Un Drole de Paroissien" by Jean-Pierre Mocky at 7 p.m. Dec. 26 at Cafe Istanbul, 2732 St. Claude Ave., New Orleans, and at 7 p.m. Friday, Jan. 6, at the alliance, 1519 Jackson Ave., New Orleans. The events are free for members and $5 for others. For information, call (504) 568-0770.

CHRISTMAS BASKETBALL CAMP: Registration is open for a Christmas basketball camp for ages 6-16 run by the St. Charles Parish department of parks and recreation. The camp will be from 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. Dec. 27-30 at the Edward A. Dufresne Community Center, 274 Judge Edward Dufresne Parkway, Luling. Campers will be grouped by age, gender and skill level and will learn and practice the fundamentals of basketball. The registration fee is $100 in advance or $125 for walk-ups, with free before-care beginning at 8 a.m. To reserve a spot, call coach Brian Lumar at (504) 931-8604. To register, visit www.stcharlesgov.net/departments/parks-and-recreation.

RIVER REGION DRAMA GUILD: A free children's theater workshop for ages 8-15 will begin with a session from 9 a.m. to noon Saturday, Jan. 7, at the River Region Performing Arts and Cultural Center, 15146 River Road, Norco. The four-session workshop will continue on Saturday mornings through Jan. 28. The children will learn acting skills and have an opportunity to participate in a performance at 2 p.m. Jan. 28. For information, call Henry Sorbet at (504) 331-0990.

JUNIOR PHILHARMONIC SOCIETY: The application deadline is Jan. 9 for instrumentalists, vocalists and dancers ages 25 and younger to audition for the 2017 concert series of the Junior Philharmonic Society. Auditions for instrumentalists and vocalists will be Jan. 28 and auditions for dancers will be Jan. 29 in Dixon Recital Hall on the Newcomb Campus of Tulane University. Audition information and applications can be found at www.jrphilnola.org. Students selected during the January auditions will perform recitals either March 26 or May 7 at 2 p.m. in Dixon Hall.

PRO BONO LAW CLINIC: A pro bono law clinic will be held from 10 a.m. to noon Saturday, Jan. 14, at the Hispanic Resource Center, 4312 Florida Ave., Kenner. Members of the law firm of Ferriol, Pérez & Gordon will provide free legal consultation on civil matters such as divorces, name changes, bankruptcy, contractor fraud and lease disputes. For information, call (504) 469-2570.

AARP SMART DRIVER CLASS: An AARP Smart Driver class will be held from 5 p.m. to 9 p.m. Feb. 22 at the Ochsner/Elmwood Fitness Center, 1200 S. Clearview Parkway, Harahan. Those completing the course will receive a certificate that may qualify them for a discount from their automobile insurer, good for up to three years. The class fee is $15 for AARP members and $20 for others. To register, call (504) 391-3213.
